meanings.definition: A pair of eyeglasses with a handle, used for viewing objects at a distance.
meanings.sent1: She peered through her lorgnette to see the stage clearly.
meanings.sent2: The elegant lady at the opera held her lorgnette delicately.
meanings.sent3: The detective used his lorgnette to spy on the suspects from afar.
meanings.sent4: Her lorgnette was like a magic wand revealing hidden details in the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The lorgnette transformed her blurry vision into sharp focus.

meanings.definition: A pair of eyeglasses with a handle, used for viewing objects up close.
meanings.sent1: The jeweler examined the diamond through his lorgnette.
meanings.sent2: She used her lorgnette to inspect the intricate details of the painting.
meanings.sent3: The chef comically tried to chop vegetables while wearing a lorgnette.
meanings.sent4: His lorgnette turned everyday items into fascinating close-up views.
meanings.sent5: With her lorgnette, she could see the tiny insects on the flower petals.
